name: Four Points by Sheraton Oklahoma City Airport

reviews.title: Nice Hotel!
reviews.text: Some of the reviews here almost scared me off! I checked in early, no problem and found my room to be very nice. TIP: it was a SPG preferred guest room, so join the loyalty program, perhaps it matters....

reviews.title: Not what I expected from a Four Points property.
reviews.text: The good:

reviews.title: Okay for an airport hotel
reviews.text: 1) room is clean.

reviews.title: Would not come back
reviews.text: 2) close to airport-actually need to drive the airport terminal loop to get to it.

reviews.title: Wow please don't book here unless you are desperate
reviews.text: 3) staff was friendly.

reviews.title: Great place to lay your head
reviews.text: I have nothing negative to say at all. Hotel is not fancy, but it was great for our trip (2adults, 1 toddler). My 2 year old enjoyed watching the airplanes go in am out of the airport. Big king bed was good and the room was clean....all I can ask for. Yes, we would stay again.

reviews.title: Tornado Alley ... no evacuation plan
reviews.text: Stayed here during a weekend of tornado watches and warnings in effect most of the weekend. When I asked what the evacuation plan was ... desk clerk said 'oh you don't want to leave the hotel.' I agreed and then he said, 'just get in the bathtub.' Mind you we were 3 women in the room and bathtub would not accommodate all of us.

reviews.title: No frills, no deals, but very close to the airport
reviews.text: Additionally, when I checked in, had asked for 2 queens and was slated for 1 king; well they were sold out but .... miraculously, or to the dismay of a follow-on guest, we were given a 2-queen room and clerk said would deal with it later.

reviews.title: Good value
reviews.text: Thumbs up: for being right on top of the airport, remarkably quiet! Navigation to the entrance was a bit tricky -- we were sent by GPS right through the airport drop-off/pickup zone.

reviews.title: Great hotel if your looking to just spend the night for an early flight in the morning
reviews.text: This is your basic, run-o-the-mill, cookie-cutter Four Points hotel. No pony rides for the kids or cotton candy for the adults, admission gets you a decent room and a comfortable bed. Standard FP amenities (though no shower gel, only bar o soap). Coffee and tea, flat screen tv. In-wall HVAC unit.

reviews.title: Not what I thought it would be
reviews.text: Upon arrival it was evident this was not a four star property, one luggage cart for the WHOLE property. The front desk reception was chaos and confusing, I guess it was Sparky's first day on the job!

reviews.title: look elsewhere
reviews.text: The tub faucet would not turn off and dripped the whole stay. The bulbs were dim in the room. My view out the window was of an unkempt shrub!

reviews.title: Avoid! Avoid! Avoid! Not up to Starwood standards!
reviews.text: For an airport hotel food service did not start till after 6 am and ended at 9:45 PM bummer.

reviews.title: More than hard to find and not worth it
reviews.text: Walls are thin I could hear the folks next door.

reviews.title: Okay for an early AM flight - otherwise NO NO NO
reviews.text: Let's start with check-in. Admittedly, this was midnight, but the person at the desk was not welcoming or professional. Silent is probably the best word to describe him.

We got this hotel on Hotwire so we didn't know the name until we paid. And then I read the reviews and seriously considered just taking the loss and getting a different hotel. But, we didn't and we are here for four nights. We checked in on the 4th of July. The front desk agent, Erica, was very pleasant. Although the hotel is basically empty we were assigned a room at the far corner of the hotel. I wonder if this room is reserved for people who reserve through Hotwire or another discount website. Anyway, the room is the first one in from the door at the remote corner of he hotel. As far from he front desk as you can get. The hotel is located at t he airport and is a distance from everything. Since we stay in okc with regularity we knew were to go to get things that we would need. There is a microwave and a refrigerator in the room so that is convenient. The room is clean and although the bathroom is a bit small it is ok. Overall, the hotel is not as bad as I had feared, but there is no way I would call it a three star hotel. It is average at best.
reviews.title: Not as bad as I feared!

reviews.text: Just checked in. Place is empty. Greeted by the CREEPIEST front desk manager ever. I mean weird. The lights in the bar and restaurant are closed-- dark. It is only 11:30 pm. The only reason I am here is to sleep, earn my Platinum Starwood status, and get out of dodge. Driving through. Airport close, yes, but there is not a decent recent or anything, for miles and miles.
reviews.title: Creepy vibe

reviews.text: The upside? They apear to clean here and free parking.
reviews.title: Oklahoma Airport Hotel

reviews.text: We are staying at a different hotel each night on an 11 day Grand Canyon Tour. This was our first stop and we are used to staying at 2 bdr. condos with our time share. This was a pretty good place for the price and everything looked pretty nice and clean. I was a little worried about it being by the airport, but only heard 1 plane. It was fairly spacious, had free wi-fi, and I didn't worry about falling sleep there. Also, compared to the next two places we stayed for a similar price, it was steps above. The only down side was that the A/C didn't seem to cool great. Even my kids were warm which is not the usual.
reviews.title: Just average...

reviews.text: Nothing stands out about this hotel.. Nothing good, nothing bad. I didn't like that I had to dig under the dusty night table to find a single outlet to charge my phone overnight. Wireless speeds @ 0.7 Mbps down/0.11 Mbps up.
reviews.title: Good for a quick stay

aka: Four Points By Sheraton Oklahoma City Airport Hotel
